summary: The document is an FBI communication dated November 18, 1966, related to the JFK assassination investigation. It details the distribution of photographs of Carlos Marcello to the Tampa and Miami offices for identification purposes by informants familiar with Santo Trafficante's associates. The document emphasizes the need for discretion to protect the identity of the informants.
key_findings: The document is part of the FBI's records on the JFK assassination.
It involves the identification of Carlos Marcello through photographs distributed to FBI offices in Tampa and Miami.
The communication stresses the importance of protecting the identity of informants by not making inquiries that could reveal their involvement.
